item.title: 芝加哥联储认为 11 月失业率稳定在 4.4%，因为其他数据显示就业岗位减少
item.description: 芝加哥联储周四估计，11月份美国失业率维持在4.4%左右不变，而一家私营供应商提供的密切关注的数据进一步证明，美国劳动力市场正在缓慢减弱。【原文：The U.S. unemployment rate was unchanged around 4.4% in November, the Chicago Federal Reserve estimated on Thursday, while closely watched data from a private provider added to the evidence that the U.S. labor market is slowly weakening.】

item.title: 纽约时报》就新闻采访权起诉五角大楼
item.description: 纽约时报》周四起诉美国国防部和国防部长皮特-黑格塞斯（Pete Hegseth），试图迫使五角大楼放弃其限制性的新新闻政策，这是美国新闻机构重新获得进入政府空间的最新尝试。【原文：The New York Times sued the U.S. Department of Defense and Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth on Thursday in an effort to force the Pentagon to abandon its restrictive new press policy, the latest attempt by a U.S. news organization to reclaim access to government spaces.】

item.title: 克罗格第三季度销售额不及预期，原因是购物者缩减开支
item.description: 由于对价格敏感的购物者和经济不确定性影响了对食品杂货和新鲜农产品的需求，克罗格公司周四的第三季度销售额未能达到华尔街的预期。【原文：Kroger missed Wall Street estimates for third-quarter sales on Thursday as price-sensitive shoppers and economic uncertainty weighed on demand for its groceries and fresh produce.】

item.title: 荷美尔食品公司因价格上涨而预测年度利润高于预期
item.description: 花生酱生产商霍梅尔食品公司（Hormel Foods）周四预计全年利润将超过预期，该公司相信其成本削减计划、价格上涨以及对火鸡肉的持续需求将克服牛肉和猪肉的高投入成本。【原文：Skippy peanut butter maker Hormel Foods forecast annual profit above estimates on Thursday, betting that its cost-cutting plan, higher prices and sustained demand for turkey will overcome high input costs of beef and pork.】

item.title: 雪花公司股价下跌，因预测第四季度产品收入增长放缓
item.description: 周四盘前交易中，Snowflake 股价暴跌 8%，原因是这家云数据分析公司预测第四季度产品收入增长放缓，部分原因是长期大额交易提供的折扣。【原文：Snowflake shares slumped 8% in premarket trading on Thursday after the cloud data analytics company forecast slower product revenue growth for the fourth quarter, partly hit by discounts offered on the large, long-term deals.】

item.title: 消息人士称，激进投资者利特敦促第一工业地产公司进行改革以提振股价
item.description: 据熟悉此事的消息人士透露，激进投资者乔纳森-利特（Jonathan Litt）希望仓库运营商第一工业房地产信托公司（First Industrial Realty Trust）出售资产、向股东返还资本并更新董事会，这些措施可能会使股价上涨 30%。【原文：Activist investor Jonathan Litt wants warehouse operator First Industrial Realty Trust to sell assets, return capital to shareholders and refresh its board, steps that could boost the stock price by 30%, according to sources familiar with the matter and a document seen by Reuters.】

item.title: Signature 银行前高管创办区块链银行
item.description: 在这家以服务加密货币客户而闻名的纽约银行倒闭近三年后，前 Signature Bank 高管正在推出一家新的基于区块链的银行，专注于促进即时、全天候的美元支付。【原文：Former Signature Bank executives are launching a new blockchain-based bank focused on facilitating instant, around-the-clock U.S. dollar payments, nearly three years after the collapse of the New York-based bank known for serving cryptocurrency clients.】

item.title: AMC 称 Aron 在轻微中风后将继续担任连锁影院首席执行官
item.description: 连锁影院 AMC Entertainment 周四表示，首席执行官亚当-阿隆（Adam Aron）在上个月轻微中风后将继续留任。【原文：Theater chain AMC Entertainment said on Thursday that chief executive officer Adam Aron will continue in his role after suffering a minor stroke last month.】

item.title: 挑战者公司称美国 11 月计划裁员下降 53
item.description: 由于企业在不确定的经济环境中艰难前行，招聘意向持续低迷。【原文：Hiring intentions continued to lag as businesses navigated an uncertain economic environment.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司 Flex 融资 6000 万美元，为中型企业提供财务工具
item.description: 旨在为中型企业主提供一站式金融服务的人工智能初创公司 Flex 周四表示，它已在 Portage Ventures 主导的一轮融资中筹集了 6000 万美元。【原文：Flex, an artificial intelligence startup that aims to be a one-stop shop for the financial needs of mid-sized business owners, said on Thursday it has raised $60 million in a Portage Ventures-led funding round.】

item.title: 独家：消息称匈牙利 MOL 公司对卢克石油公司资产感兴趣
item.description: 三位熟知内情的消息人士称，匈牙利 MOL 公司已告知美国官员，该公司有意购买受制裁的俄罗斯石油巨头卢克石油公司的国际资产，加入了越来越多的竞争者行列。【原文：Hungary's MOL has told U.S. officials it is interested in buying international assets of sanctioned Russian oil major Lukoil , three sources familiar with the matter said, joining a growing list of contenders.】

item.title: 俄罗斯嘲笑欧盟审议冻结资产问题，称扣押资产将引发 "最严厉的回应
item.description: 俄罗斯周四表示，欧盟对其被冻结资产采取的任何 "非法行动 "都将引起 "最严厉的反应"，莫斯科已在准备应对措施。【原文：Russia said on Thursday that any "illegal action" by the European Union in relation to its frozen assets would elicit "the harshest reaction", and that Moscow was already preparing its response.】

item.title: 生活必需品需求回暖，Dollar General 上调年度利润预期
item.description: 美元通用公司（Dollar General）周四上调了全年盈利预期，第三季度盈利超出预期，主要得益于其折扣店需求的恢复性增长，以及该公司在削减成本和减少库存相关损失方面所做的努力。【原文：Dollar General raised its annual profit forecast after beating third-quarter earnings estimates on Thursday, banking on resilient demand at its discount stores, as well as its efforts to cut costs and reduce inventory-related damages.】

item.title: 欧盟审议取消对中国生产的大众电动汽车征收的关税
item.description: 欧盟委员会已开始审查对大众汽车在中国生产的电动汽车征收的反补贴关税。 欧盟官方期刊周四称，欧盟委员会已开始审查对大众汽车在中国生产的电动汽车征收的反补贴关税，这可能导致以最低价格承诺取代反补贴关税。【原文：The European Commission has started a review of the anti-subsidy tariffs on Volkswagen's electric vehicles built in China, which could lead to them being replaced with a minimum price undertaking, the EU official journal said on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧盟反垄断负责人称，欧盟考虑对 Meta 采取临时措施
item.description: 欧盟反垄断局局长特雷莎-里贝拉（Teresa Ribera）周四表示，欧盟监管机构正在考虑是否就 Meta 在其信息服务 WhatsApp 中推出人工智能功能一事对其采取临时措施。【原文：EU regulators are considering whether to impose interim measures against Meta over its rollout of artificial intelligence features in its messaging service WhatsApp, EU antitrust chief Teresa Ribera said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国贸易代表格里尔告诉《政客》：特朗普明年可能决定退出 USMCA 贸易协定
item.description: 据Politico周四援引美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）的话报道，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普可能会在明年决定退出美国-墨西哥-加拿大贸易协定（USMCA）。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump could decide next year to withdraw from the United States-Mexico-Canada trade agreement (USMCA), Politico reported on Thursday, citing U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer.】

item.title: 贝莱德预计，尽管存在风险，人工智能将在 2026 年继续主导市场
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）预计，人工智能将在 2026 年继续主导市场，并预计投资者将经历一段动荡的旅程，因为投机性交易和杠杆作用增加了上个月暴跌重演的风险。【原文：BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, expects AI to continue dominating markets in 2026 and anticipates a turbulent ride for investors as speculative trading and leverage raise the risks of a repeat of last month's sharp selloff.】

item.title: 解说员：特朗普账户 "能否增加低收入美国人的储蓄？
item.description: 特朗普账户 "能否帮助低收入美国人积累财富？【原文：Will "Trump Accounts" help lower-income Americans build wealth?】

item.title: 人工智能淡香水：亚马逊为技术人员提供软件香水
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）周三展示了其 SageMaker 人工智能服务的新功能，称这将帮助客户加快定制人工智能软件模型的速度。【原文：Amazon.com on Wednesday touted new capabilities for its SageMaker AI service that it says will help customers expedite customizing their artificial intelligence software models.】

item.title: 马克-库班寻求特朗普支持减免药费以刺激仿制药生产
item.description: 亿万富翁马克-库班（Mark Cuban）周三告诉路透社，他已敦促特朗普政府免除仿制药审批所需的数十万美元监管费用。【原文：Billionaire Mark Cuban has urged the Trump administration to waive the hundreds of thousands of dollars in regulatory fees required for generic drug approvals, he told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 受迪拜巧克力热潮的推动，阿根廷将赌注押在开心果上
item.description: 在阿根廷快速发展的开心果中心地带，一排排树上结满了成熟的黄色果实，点缀着干燥的大地，这表明这个农业地区正在努力利用其有利的气候条件，以满足全世界对这种坚果的需求。【原文：In Argentina’s rapidly growing pistachio heartland, rows of trees bearing the ripening yellow fruit dot the dry landscape, a sign of how this agricultural region is striving to capitalize on its favorable climate to cash in on worldwide demand for the nut, which has been driven by the popularity of pistachio-filled Dubai chocolate.】

item.title: 台湾联电与 Polar 签订协议，探讨在美国生产 8 英寸芯片
item.description: 台湾芯片制造商联华电子公司（UMC）周四表示，已与美国极地半导体公司（Polar Semiconductor）签署谅解备忘录，探讨在美国合作生产8英寸晶圆。【原文：Taiwan chip maker United Microelectronics Corp (UMC) said on Thursday it had signed a memorandum of understanding with U.S.-based Polar Semiconductor to explore collaboration on manufacturing of 8-inch wafers in the United States.】

item.title: 为英国运动员提供人工智能保护，防止网络辱骂
item.description: 英国体育协会（UK Sport）签署了一份 30 万英镑（约合 40.170 万美元）的协议，在社交媒体上提供基于人工智能的保护，英国顶尖运动员很快将拥有打击网络侵权的新武器。【原文：Top British athletes will soon have a new weapon in the fight against online abuse after UK Sport signed a 300,000 pound ($400,170.00) deal to provide AI-based protection across social media.】

item.title: ProShares 在美国证券交易委员会停止审查后撤回部分高杠杆 ETF 计划
item.description: ETF 提供商 ProShares 在收到美国证券监管机构的警告信后，撤回了一些高杠杆交易所交易基金的注册申请，该警告信指出了风险敞口，并暂停了对此类计划的审查。【原文：ETF provider ProShares has withdrawn its registration request for some highly leveraged exchange-traded funds after receiving a warning letter from the U.S. securities regulator that flagged risk exposures and paused the review of such plans.】

item.title: 英格兰银行启动私募股权和私人信贷行业压力测试
item.description: 英格兰银行周四表示，它正在启动一项压力测试，测试私募股权和私人信贷行业如何应对金融冲击。【原文：The Bank of England said on Thursday that it was launching a stress test of how the private equity and private credit industries would deal with a financial shock.】

item.title: 据《华盛顿邮报》报道，亚马逊探索切断与美国邮政的关系
item.description: 据《华盛顿邮报》周四援引三位知情人士的话报道，亚马逊正准备扩大其全国范围的快递网络，并放弃与美国邮政服务公司的长期合作关系。【原文：Amazon is preparing to expand its nationwide delivery network and give up its long-standing partnership with the U.S. Postal Service, the Washington Post reported on Thursday, citing three people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: Meta 的 WhatsApp 人工智能政策陷入欧盟反垄断困境
item.description: 欧盟反垄断监管机构周四开始调查 Meta Platforms 有关人工智能供应商访问其消息服务 WhatsApp 的新政策，称这可能会阻碍竞争对手在欧洲提供服务。【原文：EU antitrust regulators opened on Thursday an investigation into Meta Platforms' new policy regarding AI providers' access to its messaging service WhatsApp, saying this may prevent rivals from offering their services in Europe.】

item.title: 力拓与中国中铝积极合作解决股权限制问题
item.description: 力拓首席执行官西蒙-特洛特（Simon Trott）周四表示，该矿商正积极与其主要股东中国铝业公司（Aluminium Corporation of China Limited，简称 "中铝"）合作，以解决限制该公司进行股票回购的治理制约因素。【原文：Rio Tinto CEO Simon Trott said on Thursday the miner is actively working with its main shareholder, Aluminium Corporation of China Limited (Chinalco), to resolve governance constraints that restrict the company's ability to conduct share buybacks.】

item.title: 瑞士手表因高端钟表需求旺盛，美国销售额激增 15
item.description: 本周四，奢侈品零售商瑞士钟表集团（Watches of Switzerland Group）发布报告称，受核心市场对高端钟表强劲需求的推动，该集团今年上半年在美国的销售额猛增 15%。【原文：Luxury retailer Watches of Switzerland Group reported a 15% jump in U.S. sales for the first half of the year on Thursday, boosted by strong demand for high-end timepieces in its core market.】
